subject: ENGL
title: English Composition I
description: Introduces students to expressive, expository and persuasive writing. Assignments are based on personal experience and research. Student must earn a grade of C or better to pass. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Course Attributes: General Education-English, No Drop Allowed Prerequisites: Prereq for ENGL1010 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: UNIV 1100 Minimum Grade of D May be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: DSPW 0800 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( DSPW 4 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( A01 18 to 36 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( S07 390 to 450 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: English Composition II
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010. Builds on writing and research processes taught in ENGL 1010; emphasizes critical reading, critical thinking, and critical writing (persuasion) about a variety of written texts and other media. Student must earn a grade of C or better to pass. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Course Attributes: General Education-English, No Drop Allowed, Service Learning 1 Prerequisites: Prereq for ENGL1020 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

title: Mythology
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Greek and Roman myths in relation to modern life and literature. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL3500 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: The Bible as Literature
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper-division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2230 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. This course examines the wide variety of genres and narratives that form the Bible—from the mythological and genealogical to the poetic and prophetic—and does this from critical, literary, cultural, and rhetorical perspectives. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prereq for ENG3600 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 May not be taken concurrently. )

description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Study of the literature and literary movements of the period, with emphasis on romanticism and/or realism. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department

subject: ENGL
title: Modern American Lit
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Study of the literature and literary movements of the period, with emphasis on the twentieth century and/or contemporary period. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Course Attributes: Undergraduate Research 1 Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL4330 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Topics in American Literature
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Thematic, interdisciplinary or genre-based approaches to American literary study beyond the usual scope of ENGL 4310 (5310), ENGL 4320 (5321), or ENGL 4330 (5330). Course may be repeated provided the content is different each time.. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Course Attributes: Undergraduate Research 1 Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL4340 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Writing in the Professions
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. This course builds on students’ present writing competency and focuses on writing in their particular majors and/or professions. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL4411 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Forms of Arg & Pers:Theo/Pract
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Introduces students to various models of argumentation through theory (readings) and practice (analysis and production). 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL4421 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Creative Writing: Fiction
description: Prerequisite: Grade of C or better in ENGL 3400 or prior consent of the instructor. Guided practice in the craft and art of writing short fiction. Course may be repeated provided the content is different each time. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Course Attributes: Undergraduate Research 1 Prerequisites: Prereq for ENGL4430 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Creative Writing: Essay
description: Prerequisite: Grade of C or better in ENGL 3400 or prior consent of the instructor. Guided practice in the craft and art of writing personal essays. Course may be repeated, provided the content is different each time. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prereq for ENGL4440 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Creative Writing: Poetry
description: Prerequisite: Grade of C or better in ENGL 3400 or prior consent of the instructor. Guided practice in the craft and art of writing poetry. Course may be repeated provided the content is different each time. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prereq for ENGL4450 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Intro/Rhetoric:Theory & Pract
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. The course introduces students to rhetoric–history and special topics. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department

subject: ENGL
title: Lit Mag Editing/Iris Review
description: Prerequisite: Grade of C or better in ENGL 3400 or prior consent of the instructor. Creation of a literary magazine annual edition from initial call for submissions through publication. Course may be repeated one provided the content is different. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prereq for ENGL 4460 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 3400 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Intro/Descriptive Linguistics
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235, or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Introduction to descriptive analysis of language: phonology, morphology, lexicon, and syntax. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prerequisites for ENGL4511 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: History-English Language
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235, or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. History of the language from its origins to the present; emphasis upon historical development of English sounds, word structure, and syntax. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Course Attributes: Undergraduate Research 1 Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL4521 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Grammar and Language
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Grammatical structure of English in relation to dialect and register with some emphasis on historical and potential changes in grammar. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL4531 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Topics in Linguistics/Language
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Examination of specific aspects of language and/or linguistic study, such as Old and Middle English, the language of dialect literature or American English dialects. Course may be repeated provided the content is different each time. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL4541 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: American English
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. This class will examine American English from multiple cultural and linguistic angles and allow the students to develop their own understanding of how the language around them shapes their lives. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department

description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. Coursework or directed individual research in any area where there is no other course offering. 2.000 Credit hours 2.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Prerequisites: Prerequisite for ENGL4982 General Requirements: ( Course or Test: ENGL 1010 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. and Course or Test: ENGL 1020 Minimum Grade of C May not be taken concurrently. ) and ( Course or Test: ENGL 2130 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2235 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. ) or ( Course or Test: ENGL 2330 Minimum Grade of D May not be taken concurrently. )

subject: ENGL
title: Topics
description: Prerequisite: ENGL 1010 and ENGL 1020 and one course from among ENGL 2130, ENGL 2235, and ENGL 2330 are prerequisites for all upper division courses. The prerequisite for upper-division courses of ENGL 2130 or ENGL 2235 or ENGL 2330 is waived for ENGL and SEEN majors. subject: ENGL
title: Internship
description: Prerequisites: Junior or senior status, at least two ENGL courses at the 3000-level or above, and consent of the chair or internship coordinator. This course is for English majors only. Part-time employment in a business or institution setting related to a student's academic and career goals, and contextualized by guided written reflection with a faculty member. Cannot be taken in place of core English courses (ENGL 3000, ENGL 3810, ENGL 3820, ENGL 3910, ENGL 3920, ENGL 4121, ENGL 4995). 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Other hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Internship English Department Course Attributes: Work Based Learning 4 Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Majors: English Must be enrolled in one of the following Classifications: Senior Junior

subject: ENGL
title: Senior Colloquium
description: Prerequisites: Senior standing as an English BA major; completion of all required ENGL 3000-level courses. Intensive study of a theme or period selected by the instructor, with an emphasis on research, writing, discussion, and presentation. 3.000 Credit hours 3.000 Lecture hours Levels: Undergraduate Schedule Types: Lecture English Department Course Attributes: Undergraduate Research 1 Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Majors: English Must be enrolled in one of the following Classifications: Senior
